description: The Paystack Model Context Protocol (MCP) server allows AI agents to interact with Paystack through standardized MCP clients via tool calling. This protocol supports various tools to interact with different Paystack services.

paystackSecretKey.description: Your Paystack secret key for API access

tools.name: create_product
tools.description: Create a new product on your Paystack integration

price.description: The price of the product. Price should be in the subunit of the supported currency

quantity.description: Number of products in stock. This is required if unlimited is false.

unlimited.description: Whether the product has an unlimited quantity. Set to true if the product has unlimited stock. Leave as false if the product has limited stock

tools.name: list_products
tools.description: List products available on your Paystack integration with pagination support

to.description: A timestamp at which to stop listing product e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

from.description: A timestamp from which to start listing product e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

page.description: The page number to retrieve. Default is 1

perPage.description: Number of records to retrieve per page. If not specified we use a default value of 50

tools.name: get_product
tools.description: Get details of a specific product by ID

id.description: The id of the product to retrieve

tools.name: update_product
tools.description: Update an existing product by ID

id.description: The id of the product to update

price.description: The price of the product. Price should be in the subunit of the supported currency

quantity.description: Number of products in stock. This is required if unlimited is false.

unlimited.description: Whether the product has an unlimited quantity. Set to true if the product has unlimited stock. Leave as false if the product has limited stock

tools.name: create_customer
tools.description: Create a new customer in Paystack

metadata.description: Additional structured data for the customer

tools.name: list_customers
tools.description: List customers available on your Paystack integration

to.description: A timestamp at which to stop listing customers e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

from.description: A timestamp from which to start listing customers e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

tools.name: get_customer
tools.description: Get details of a specific customer by email or code

tools.name: update_customer
tools.description: Update a customer's details

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to the customer. It can be used to store additional information in a structured format.

tools.name: validate_customer
tools.description: Validate a customer's identity with bank account

type.description: Predefined types of identification. Only bank_account is supported at the moment

tools.name: set_customer_risk_action
tools.description: Whitelist or blacklist a customer

risk_action.description: One of the possible risk actions [ default, allow, deny ]. allow to whitelist. deny to blacklist. Customers start with a default risk action.

tools.name: deactivate_authorization
tools.description: Deactivate a payment authorization when a card needs to be forgotten

tools.name: initialize_transaction
tools.description: Initialize a transaction to accept payment on Paystack

plan.description: If transaction is to create a subscription to a predefined plan, provide plan code here.

amount.description: The amount to charge in the subunit of the supported currency

bearer.description: Who bears Paystack charges? account or subaccount (defaults to account).

channels.description: An array of payment channels to control what channels you want to make available to the user to make a payment with. Available channels include: ["card", "bank", "apple_pay", "ussd", "qr", "mobile_money", "bank_transfer", "eft"]

currency.description: The currency to charge in. Default is your integration currency.

metadata.description: Additional information to store with the transaction.

reference.description: Unique transaction reference. Only -, ., = and alphanumeric characters allowed. If not provided, a unique reference will be generated.

split_code.description: The split code of the transaction split.

subaccount.description: The code for the subaccount that owns the payment. e.g. ACCT_8f4s1eq7ml6rlzj

callback_url.description: URL to redirect to after payment. Only required for inline payment methods.

transaction_charge.description: A flat fee to charge the subaccount for this transaction (in the subunit of the supported currency).

tools.name: verify_transaction
tools.description: Verify a transaction's status using the transaction reference

tools.name: fetch_transaction
tools.description: Get details of a transaction by ID

id.description: The ID of the transaction to fetch

tools.name: list_transactions
tools.description: List transactions with pagination and filtering options

to.description: Filter transactions to this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

from.description: Filter transactions from this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

page.description: Page number to retrieve. Default is 1.

amount.description: Filter transactions by amount. Value is in kobo, pesewas or cents.

perPage.description: Number of records to retrieve per page. Default is 50.

customer.description: Filter transactions by customer ID or code.

tools.name: charge_authorization
tools.description: Charge a previously authorized card

amount.description: The amount to charge in the subunit of the supported currency

currency.description: The currency to charge in. Default is your integration currency.

metadata.description: Additional information to store with the transaction.

reference.description: Unique transaction reference. If not provided, a unique reference will be generated.

tools.name: partial_debit
tools.description: Charge a partial amount from a previously authorized card

amount.description: The amount to charge in the subunit of the supported currency

at_least.description: Minimum amount to charge in kobo, pesewas or cents.

currency.description: The currency to charge in. Default is your integration currency.

reference.description: Unique transaction reference. If not provided, a unique reference will be generated.

tools.name: transaction_totals
tools.description: Get total amount received on your account

to.description: A timestamp at which to stop listing transaction e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

from.description: A timestamp from which to start listing transaction e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

page.description: Page number to retrieve. Default is 1.

perPage.description: Number of records to retrieve per page. Default is 50.

tools.name: export_transactions
tools.description: Export a list of transactions carried out on your integration

to.description: A timestamp at which to stop listing transaction e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z, 2016-09-21

from.description: A timestamp from which to start listing transaction e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z, 2016-09-21

page.description: Specify exactly what page you want to retrieve. Default is 1.

amount.description: Filter transactions by amount, using the supported currency

perPage.description: Specify how many records you want to retrieve per page. Default is 50.

settled.description: Set to true to export only settled transactions. false for pending transactions. Leave undefined to export all transactions

currency.description: Specify the transaction currency to export

customer.description: Specify an ID for the customer whose transactions you want to retrieve

settlement.description: An ID for the settlement whose transactions we should export

payment_page.description: Specify a payment page's id to export only transactions conducted on said page

tools.name: list_banks
tools.description: Get a list of all banks supported by Paystack and their properties

next.description: A cursor that indicates your place in the list. It can be used to fetch the next page of the list

type.description: Type of financial channel. For Ghanaian channels, please use either mobile_money for mobile money channels OR ghipps for bank channels

country.description: The country from which to obtain the list of supported banks. Accepted values are: ghana, kenya, nigeria, south africa

gateway.description: The gateway type of the bank. It can be one of these: [emandate, digitalbankmandate]

perPage.description: The number of objects to return per page. Defaults to 50, and limited to 100 records per page.

previous.description: A cursor that indicates your place in the list. It should be used to fetch the previous page of the list after an intial next request

use_cursor.description: Flag to enable cursor pagination on the endpoint

pay_with_bank.description: A flag to filter for banks a customer can pay directly from

include_nip_sort_code.description: A flag that returns Nigerian banks with their nip institution code. The returned value can be used in identifying institutions on NIP.

pay_with_bank_transfer.description: A flag to filter for available banks a customer can make a transfer to complete a payment

enabled_for_verification.description: A flag to filter the banks that are supported for account verification in South Africa. You need to combine this with either the currency or country filter.

tools.name: list_countries
tools.description: Get a list of countries that Paystack currently supports

tools.name: list_states
tools.description: Get a list of states for a country for address verification

country.description: The country code of the states to list. It is gotten after the charge request.

tools.name: check_balance
tools.description: Get the available balance on your Paystack integration

tools.name: balance_ledger
tools.description: Fetch all pay-ins and pay-outs that occurred on your Paystack integration

to.description: A timestamp at which to stop listing balance ledger entries e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

from.description: A timestamp from which to start listing balance ledger entries e.g. 2016-09-24T00:00:05.000Z

page.description: Page number to retrieve. Default is 1.

perPage.description: Number of records to retrieve per page. Default is 50.

tools.name: resend_transfers_otp
tools.description: Generates a new OTP and sends to customer for transfer verification

tools.name: disable_transfers_otp
tools.description: Disable OTP requirement for transfers

tools.name: finalize_disable_otp
tools.description: Finalize the request to disable OTP on your transfers

otp.description: OTP sent to business phone to verify disabling OTP requirement

tools.name: enable_transfers_otp
tools.description: Enable OTP requirement for transfers
